prompt.p: A 40-year-old lady presents to her GP with several months' history of tiredness on exertion, shortness of breath and palpitations. A systematic review reveals that she suffers from menorrhagia.
Blood tests reveal that her Hb is 9.8 g/dL (normal range 11.5–16.5 g/dL) and her MCV is 70 fl (normal range 80–96).
Which of the following is the most likely cause of her anaemia?

modalFeedback.p:
Option B (Iron-deficiency anaemia) is Correct. Iron deficiency is the most likely cause of her anaemia. Menorrhagia leads to this. It is very common in women of this age.
Option A (Folate deficiency) is Incorrect. It causes macrocytic anaemia.
Option C (Pregnancy) is Incorrect. It causes normocytic anaemia.
Option D (Sideroblastic anaemia) is Incorrect. It is a possible cause of microcytic anaemia but is much less common than iron deficiency.
Option E (B 12 deficiency) is Incorrect.
It causes macrocytic anaemia.
